trans-unit.source: The DROP ROLE statement allows you to drop an SQL role.

seg-source.mrk: The DROP ROLE statement allows you to drop an SQL role.

target.mrk: The DROP ROLE statement allows you to drop an SQL role.

trans-unit.source: Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can drop a role.

seg-source.mrk: Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can drop a role.

target.mrk: Only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can drop a role.

trans-unit.source: For more information on roles, see "Using SQL roles" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information on roles, see "Using SQL roles" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information on roles, see "Using SQL roles" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: Dropping a role has the effect of removing the role from the database dictionary. This means that no session user can henceforth set that role (see <xref href="rrefsetrole.dita#rrefsetrole"></xref>), and any existing sessions that have that role as the current role (see <xref href="rrefcurrentrole.dita#rrefcurrentrole"></xref>) will now have a NULL CURRENT_ROLE. Dropping a role also has the effect of revoking that role from any user and role it has been granted to. See <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on how revoking a role may impact any dependent objects.

seg-source.mrk: Dropping a role has the effect of removing the role from the database dictionary.

This means that no session user can henceforth set that role (see <xref href="rrefsetrole.dita#rrefsetrole"></xref>), and any existing sessions that have that role as the current role (see <xref href="rrefcurrentrole.dita#rrefcurrentrole"></xref>) will now have a NULL CURRENT_ROLE.
Dropping a role also has the effect of revoking that role from any user and role it has been granted to.
See <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on how revoking a role may impact any dependent objects.

target.mrk: Dropping a role has the effect of removing the role from the database dictionary.

This means that no session user can henceforth set that role (see <xref href="rrefsetrole.dita#rrefsetrole"></xref>), and any existing sessions that have that role as the current role (see <xref href="rrefcurrentrole.dita#rrefcurrentrole"></xref>) will now have a NULL CURRENT_ROLE.
Dropping a role also has the effect of revoking that role from any user and role it has been granted to.
See <xref href="rrefsqljrevoke.dita#rrefsqljrevoke"></xref> for information on how revoking a role may impact any dependent objects.
